title: Texas Hold' Em, Kin, and Cloistered Nuns
teaser:
Professional gambler Annie Duke details a pivotal poker game at the televised Tournament of Champions; road rage lands a  new mom in jail; a young woman is about to give birth just as her grandfather is dying; and a Holocaust survivor describes hiding with cloistered nuns as a little girl during World War 2. Hosted by The Moth’s Producing Director, Sarah Austin Jenness. 

The Moth Radio Hour is produced by The Moth and Jay Allison of Atlantic Public Media.

Note: some stories are emotionally intense and not for children. See the Content Advisory below.
description:
Annie Duke plays the most high-stakes poker game of her life, live on camera, in Las Vegas.
Stacy Keene learns that her grandfather is terminally ill just as she announces her first pregnancy.
Adam Fawer must bail his hot-headed wife out of jail after a traffic incident gets her arrested.
Flora Hogman survives the Holocaust but loses her identity while hidden in a convent with nuns.
Sarah Austin Jenness hosts
